lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: To be, or not to be

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: that is the question

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: Whether 'tis nobler in the mind to suffer
alt: Whether it is nobler in the mind to suffer

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: The slings and arrows of outrageous fortune

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: Or to take arms against a sea of troubles

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: And by opposing end them?

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: To die

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: to sleep

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: No more

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: and by a sleep

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: to say we end the heart-ache and

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: the thousand natural shocks That flesh is heir to,
alt: the thousand natural shocks That flesh is air to

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: 'tis a consummation

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: Devoutly to be wish'd.

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: To die, to sleep

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: To sleep

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: perchance to dream

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: ay, there's the rub

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: For in that sleep of death what dreams may come

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: When we have shuffled off this mortal coil,

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: Must give us pause

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: there's the respect

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: That makes calamity of so long life

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: For who would bear the whips and scorns of time,

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: The oppressor's wrong,

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: the proud man's contumely,

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: The pangs of despised love,

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: the law's delay,

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: The insolence of office and

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: the spurns That patient merit of the unworthy takes,

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: When he himself might his quietus make

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: With a bare bodkin?

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: who would fardels bear,

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: To grunt and sweat under a weary life,

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: But that the dread of something after death,

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: The undiscover'd country from whose bourn

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: No traveller returns, puzzles the will

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: And makes us rather bear those ills we have

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: Than fly to others that we know not of?

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: Thus conscience does make cowards of us all

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: And thus the native hue of resolution

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: Is sicklied o'er with the pale cast of thought,
alt: Is sicklied over with the pale cast of thought,

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: And enterprises of great pith and moment

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: With this regard their currents turn awry,

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: And lose the name of action. - Soft you now!

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: The fair Ophelia! Nymph, in thy orisons

lines.speaker: HAMLET
lines.line: Be all my sins remember'd.
